intro: Macielia arborea, commonly known as the tree of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stem and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Macielia arborea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
